sen.j: 1937年（昭和12年）に東京からロンドンまでの100時間を切る記録飛行に成功した朝日新聞社の航空機は九七式司令部偵察機神風号と称し、その乗務員が帰国して前述した伊勢神宮に参拝する事になったため、同年5月24日に現在の近畿日本鉄道（近鉄）の母系会社である大阪電気軌道（大軌）とその子会社の参宮急行電鉄（参急）は、大阪の上本町駅（現・大阪上本町駅）から伊勢神宮外宮の最寄駅である宇治山田駅まで臨時列車の記念近鉄特急を運行し、その特急電車も「近鉄特急史参宮急行電鉄号」と名づけられた。
sen.e: The airplane of Asahi Shinbun (Asahi Newspaper) that successfully completed one hundred hour record flight from Tokyo to London in 1937 was called as Kyunanashiki sireibu teisatsuki Kamikaze go (Ninety-seven Type Scouting Plane Kamikaze) and since the members went to worship at Isejingu Shrine mentioned earlier that Osakadenkikido (Ookido) of the matrilineal company of the current Kinki Nippon Railways (Kintetsu) and its child company Sangu Express Railways (Sankyu) operated special emergency Kintetsu Express train from Uehonmachi in Osaka (current Uehonmachi Station, Osaka) to Ujiyamada Station closest to Toyokedaijingu of Isejingu Shrine and named that express train as "Kintetsu Tokkyusisangu kyukodentetsugo" (Kintetsu Express Train History Sangu Express Train) on May 24 of the same year.

The airplane of Asahi Shinbun (Asahi Newspaper) that successfully completed a one hundred hour record flight from Tokyo to London in 1937 was called Kyunanashiki sireibu teisatsuki Kamikaze go (Ninety-seven Type Scouting Plane Kamikaze) and since the members worshiped at Isejingu Shrine, mentioned earlier, the Osakadenkikido (Ookido) of the matrilineal company of the current Kinki Nippon Railways (Kintetsu) and its subsidiary company, Sangu Express Railways (Sankyu), operated a special emergency Kintetsu Express train from Uehonmachi in Osaka (current Uehonmachi Station, Osaka) to Ujiyamada Station, the closest to Toyokedaijingu of Isejingu Shrine and named that express train "Kintetsu Tokkyusisangu kyukodentetsugo" (Kintetsu Express Train History Sangu Express Train) on May 24 of the same year.

The Asahi Shinbun plane that successfully completed a record-breaking 100-hour flight from Tokyo to London in 1937 was named "Kyunanashiki shireibu teisatsuki kamikaze go" (Type-97 'Divine Wind' Scout-plane), and because its crew members intended to worship at the aforementioned Ise Jingu Shrine upon their return to Japan, on May 24 of the same year, the Osaka Electric Tramway (Daiki), parent company to the contemporary Kinki Nippon Railways (Kintetsu), and its subsidiary, Sangu Express Railways (Sankyu), began service on a special commemoratory link from Uehonmachi (today's Uehonmachi Station) in Osaka to Ujiyamada station, the closest train station to Ise Jingu Shrine; they named this express train the "Kintetsu Tokkyu Shisangu Tetsugo" (the Kintetsu 'Historic Shrine Visit' Express).
